page.title: 13Recreation at Froghall
page.content: In 1950 the Caldon Canal was still used for pleasure boating, until a lock gate broke and the boat trips came to an abrupt halt. The Cauldon Canal society was formed in the 1960s. Soon plans were made to rebuild the locks and clear the canal. Then in 1974 the Caldon Canal was marvelously restored. In 1978 Bill and Jackie Young came to Froghall Wharf, which had been made into a picnic area, to start a business with a horse-drawn trip boat called Birdswood. In 1981 the Youngs converted the old warehouse into a coffee shop. Bill and Jackie run boat trips along the Caldon Canal for over 10,000 tourists every year. Within 200 years Froghall Wharf has changed from a hive of industry to a popular tourist attraction.
